name: SAZKA Group a.s.
legal: a.s. (joint-stock company incorporated under the laws of the Czech Republic).
goal: SAZKA Group a.s. is one of the largest consumer gaming holding companies in Europe. Its business is focused on lottery and sports betting. SAZKA Group a.s. is the sole owner of the Czech lottery company SAZKA and has significant shareholdings in the Greek lottery OPAP, LOTTOITALIA, Casinos Austria and Austrian Lotteries and SuperSport (Croatia). SAZKA Group a.s. strives to bring innovation to the lottery and gaming industry; the vision is to continue expanding whilst adhering to responsible gaming principles, in particular by providing customers with entertainment and life-changing opportunities in a responsible, professional and efficient manner, while having a positive impact on the societies in which it operates.  Responsibility is one of the key differentiators of how the SAZKA Group a.s. operates lotteries and other gaming activities compared to other forms of competition, illegal competition in particular.  Being clearly committed to responsible gaming principles, corporate responsibility is at the heart of the group’s activities.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Enlargement, General and Institutional Affairs, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
EU initiatives in the gaming sector: follow up to the EC Communication on the European Framework for online gambling (COM (2012) 596 final) and the Council Recommendation on principles for the protection of consumers and players of online gambling services and for the prevention of minors from gambling online (2014/478/EU);

Standardisation request to the European Committee for Standardisation – CEN - as regards ‘a European standard on reporting in support of supervision of online gambling services by the gambling regulatory authorities of the Member States'.

Proposal COM (2017) 0386 re: the Council of Europe Convention on the manipulation of sports competitions with regard to matters related to substantive criminal law and judicial cooperation in criminal matters (against match fixing);

Amended proposal for a regulation on the European Supervisory Authority on AML (Com (2018) 646);

Implementation of the Audiovisual Media Services Directive (AVMS –COM (2016) 287 final), with special focus on "illegal content";

Proposal for a Regulation on Promoting fairness and transparency for users of online intermediation services COM (2018) 238 final;


New Deal for Consumers Package: Proposal for a directive on representative actions for the protection of the collective interests of consumers, and repealing Directive 2009/22/EC COM (2018) 184 and Proposal for a directive amending Council Directive 93/13/EEC of 5 April 1993, Directive 98/6/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, Directive 2005/29/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council and Directive 2011/83/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards better enforcement and modernisation of EU consumer protection rules COM (2018) 185;

Proposal for a directive laying down rules relating to the corporate taxation of a significant digital presence COM (2018) 0072 and proposal for a directive on the common system of a digital services tax on revenues resulting from the provision of certain digital services COM (2018) 0073;

Proposal for a regulation on ENISA - Cybersecurity act (Com (2017) 477);

Proposal for a regulation establishing the European Cybersecurity Industrial, Technology and Research Competence Center and the network of National Coordination Centers (Com (2018) 630);

Proposal for a directive on combating fraud and counterfeiting of non-cash means of payment (Com (2017) 489).
